title: Are asylum suicides an unfolding national tragedy?
description: Campaigners call for an inquiry into the rate of suicides among young asylum seekers in the UK.

title: Stealthing: California bans non-consensual condom removal
description: Victims of "stealthing" risk sexually transmitted infections and pregnancy. Now they can sue offenders.

title: Smart headbands claim to make people calmer. Do they work?
description: Devices that measure brainwaves are increasingly being used by athletes to improve their performance.

title: Drugs, arms, and terror: A high-profile defector on Kim's North Korea
description: A former colonel describes a leadership making cash by any means, from drug factories to illegal arms deals.

title: Expelled: Russia, repression and me
description: The BBC's Sarah Rainsford reflects on being barred from Russia and the assault on the country's freedoms.

title: The race to save California’s famous sequoia trees
description: Tourists flock to California’s famous sequoia trees, but wildfires are threatening their existence.

title: Mbappe gives France comeback win in Nations League final against Spain
description: Kylian Mbappe hit a contentious winner as France came from behind to beat Spain and become the second team to win the Nations League.

title: Northamptonshire: Thousands attend World Conker Championships
description: Jasmine Tetley retained her 2019 title after the 2020 event was cancelled due to Covid.

title: Was AQ Khan the most dangerous man in the world?
description: Western spies branded AQ Khan as dangerous as bin Laden - but many in Pakistan saw him as a hero.

title: Tyson Fury: Gypsy King on road to undisputed fight, but Dillian Whyte bout likely next
description: Tyson Fury will have to wait to see how several fights pan out before deciding his next opponent.

title: Olivier Rousteing: Balmain designer reveals fireplace explosion injuries
description: Olivier Rousteing, creative director of Balmain, shared a picture of himself swathed in bandages.

title: England name strongest available squad for Ashes series
description: England announce a strong squad for the 2021-22 Ashes Test series in Australia led by captain Joe Root.

title: Channel crossings: More than 1,100 migrants cross in two days
description: French authorities prevented 414 people from making the crossing, the Home Office says.

title: Abdul Qadeer Khan: 'Father of Pakistan's nuclear bomb' dies
description: AQ Khan is considered a national hero but was also called "the greatest nuclear proliferator of all time".

title: Gas prices: Kwarteng says energy price cap won't move this winter
description: Keeping the price cap is non-negotiable, the business secretary says, as suppliers call for changes.

title: Chris Packham: Fire attack on New Forest home will not sway me
description: The broadcaster vows to continue campaigning after a suspected arson attack outside his home.

title: Kraft Heinz says people must get used to higher food prices
description: The boss of the food giant says rising prices are partly due to pandemic disruption.

title: China-Taiwan tensions: We will not bow to Beijing pressure, says leader
description: Tsai Ing-wen's speech comes a day after China's President Xi vowed to complete "reunification".

title: Fury beats Wilder in thrilling Vegas fight
description: Tyson Fury delivers 11th-round stoppage to beat Deontay Wilder and retain his WBC heavyweight title in a thrilling trilogy fight in Las Vegas.

title: Brexit: UK's NI Protocol demands 'could break relations'
description: Ireland's foreign minister says the demands are a new "red line" that the EU cannot move on.

title: Tyson Fury says he is 'greatest heavyweight of my era' after beating Deontay Wilder
description: Tyson Fury crowns himself the "greatest heavyweight of my era" after defending his WBC crown in a classic fight against Deontay Wilder.

title: Tyson Fury v Deontay Wilder III: 'Wilder has been a good dance partner, but it's done' - Fury proud to retain crown
description: Tyson Fury says his rivalry with Deontay Wilder is "done", after knocking Wilder out in the 11th round to retain his WBC heavyweight crown.

title: 'One of the greatest fights I’ve ever seen' - how the Rock and rest of world reacted to Fury-Wilder epic
description: The Gypsy King's reign over the heavyweight division goes on - Fight Talk looks at how the boxing world reacted to Tyson Fury's stunning win against Deontay Wilder in Las Vegas.

title: Covid: How easy is it for patients to book a GP appointment in Wales?
description: Some can't get through on the phone. Some find new apps very useful. GP patients speak up.

title: The rescue dog trainer proving pets can sniff out epileptic seizures
description: Dog trainer Neil Powell's work shows that dogs can warn owners about upcoming epileptic seizures.

title: Art promoter, activist, political thinker - why Itoje is more than just a rugby player
description: One of the most important black British athletes of today, Maro Itoje is inspiring the next generation on and off the field.

title: The Papers: 'Nursing crisis' hits wards, and PM faces 'Brexit clash'
description: Shortages of nursing staff and supply chain issues facing the UK feature in Sunday's papers.

title: Guatemala police free 126 migrants from abandoned container
description: Police say the mainly Haitian migrants were left by smugglers paid to take them to the US.

title: Covid-19: Two million booster jabs administered, and patient a 'cat with nine lives'
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday.
